column1: After summarizing the seven questions put by Freud in his 1937 paper 'Analysis terminable and interminable', the author reports on the case of a female patient in whose second analysis four opportunities for growth arose: the consolidation of insights from several traumas; a preverbal main trauma providing depth to her narrative; the benefit of a permanent auxiliary ego to perform certain psychical functions; and the challenge of overcoming resistance to analysis of her sexual inhibitions.
